meaningMnemonic: A <kanji>government</kanji> behind a <kanji>curtain</kanji> is the <vocabulary>bakufu</vocabulary>. They didn't let anyone know their government secrets so they would hide behind that curtain and keep everything to themselves.
readingMnemonic:
This is a jukugo word that uses the on'yomi readings of the kanji. You haven't learned this reading for 幕 yet, so here's a mnemonic to help you:

If you try to peek through the <vocabulary>bakufu</vocabulary>'s curtain you'll only see someone's <reading>back</reading> (ばく). They all huddle together to discuss things so a row of hunched backs is all you'll get out of the shogunate. That's not helpful.
